page.title: 04EDUCATION - VILLAGE SCHOOL
page.content: Once there were three separate schools in Hodnet, Infants,Girls' & Boys',each with its own headteacher. These were combined and in 1985 it was a County Primary (5-11) school. There are 125 pupils on roll, in 5 classes,2 infant and 3 Junior. Two classes are in the old school and three are in temporary buildings. The old boys'school is used as a dining hall and canteen. The Head is Mr.A.Barnett, Deputy Head Mrs Cope, + 3 teachers, a Cleaner,3 Cooks,a Road Crossing Patrol Officer, and 3 Dinner ladies. Children come from Hodnet, Wollerton, Marchamley, Peplow & High Hatton; many come by taxi or mini-bus. School starts at 9.00 and ends at 3.00p.m.,with an hour for lunch (12-1) Children leave at 11 yrs old to go on to the Grove School Market Drayton, where they stay until 16.{A new School is due to open in June 1986. A.A.B.
